title: China’s birth rate incentives not yet moving the needle for weary families
description: New statistics from China’s health authority show the proportion of second, third children is still dropping, even with numerous measures in place to incentivise births.

title: Xi Jinping to host Chilean President Gabriel Boric for talks in Beijing
description: Gabriel Boric is expected to attempt to lure renewal energy investments to Chile, which is home to 48 per cent of global lithium reserves, a mineral needed for EV batteries.

title: US man shot dead after ramming car into Chinese consulate identified as Zhanyuan Yang, 31
description: San Francisco police opened fire at the driver, who later died in hospital. A witness said he had been yelling about the Chinese Communist Party.

title: Property crisis pushes China to increase financial risk monitoring, asset disposal for troubled small banks
description: China is striving to establish a high-quality inclusive financial system over the next five years, although its financial stability is under pressure from the ongoing property crisis triggered by Evergrande and Country Garden.

title: China, EU ‘can play great part’ in climate battle, bloc energy chief Kadri Simson says in call to join methane pledge
description: Revealing agreement on closer climate cooperation, Commissioner for Energy Kadri Simson urges China to commit to global pledges to cut methane emissions and triple renewable energy capacity by 2030.

title: China builds world’s largest deep sea telescope to hunt for cosmic neutrinos
description: The Trident project will be up to 10,000 times more powerful than the IceCube observatory at the South Pole, researchers said.

title: China’s graft-busters to ‘delve deep’ in new round of corruption inspections
description: Li Xi, head of the CCDI, says five government departments and 26 state-owned enterprises are in the cross hairs.

title: Israel-Hamas war: mother of kidnapped woman says daughter is Israeli, not Chinese
description: Liora Argamani says her daughter Noa was born in Israel, not China, as indicated in an Israeli embassy social media post.

title: Chinese storage specialist Longsys, a major client of US chip maker Micron, completes US$132 million takeover of Suzhou plant from Taiwan’s Powertech
description: Longsys, one of US chip maker Micron’s largest clients in China, has acquired a 70 per cent equity stake in Powertech Technology (Suzhou), which provides chip packaging, testing and surface-mount technology services in eastern Jiangsu province.

title: China graduates expect less pay as salary hopes turn ‘very rational’ and blue-collar jobs shine
description: Findings from a Chinese recruitment platform, based on surveys and résumés, show how the nation’s slow economic recovery is affecting job outlooks among those struggling most to find work.

title: US Navy reconnaissance plane passes through Taiwan Strait, closely watched by Chinese jets
description: US Navy’s 7th Fleet says P-8A Poseidon transited strait via international airspace on Thursday, upholding ‘navigational rights and freedoms of all nations’.

title: Chinese President Xi Jinping visits aircraft maker supplying helicopters for PLA’s Taiwan sorties
description: Changhe Aircraft Industries Corporation’s Z-8 and Z -10 attack helicopters have been reported to be part of PLA sorties into Taiwan’s air defence zone over the past three years

title: China names Qi Yanjun as second-in-command of nation’s police force
description: Deputy public security minister will be ‘in charge of daily operations’. He has long been a deputy to police chief Wang Xiaohong.

title: Ambassador says US working to stabilise ties with China, questions Beijing’s peace efforts in conflict hotspots
description: Nicholas Burns speaks highly of recent high-level engagement and says Washington hopes to continue to stabilise ties with ‘greatest rival’. However he says US is disappointed by China’s response to Israel-Hamas conflict.

title: China-India border talks: dispute to be resolved ‘as soon as possible’
description: 20th round of commander-level meetings agrees to seek ‘mutually acceptable’ solution, the Chinese foreign ministry said.

title: How Shanghai became an inter-war haven for European Jews fleeing persecution
description: While many European countries restricted access, the city did not require permits and became known as a ‘modern-day Noah’s Ark’.

title: AI jobs with average of US$2,600 per month top choices for Chinese graduates in 2023 amid record youth unemployment
description: The AI industry offers the highest average salary for university graduates in China, followed by blockchain, according to a report by recruitment platform Liepin.

title: EU top diplomat Borrell talks Russia, Taiwan and de-risking
description: Borrell, who will visit China from Thursday to Saturday, says massive trade deficit with China is not just a product of competitive disadvantage but also includes ‘persistent market access problems’.

title: Israel-Hamas war: China’s Middle East envoy tells Palestinian official that ceasefire is ‘top priority’
description: Along with providing humanitarian aid, Beijing says it wants to play ‘constructive role in promoting a comprehensive, just and lasting solution to the question of Palestine’.

title: South China Sea: only diplomacy can avert open China-Philippines conflict
description: Relations between Beijing and Manila keep getting worse as neither side is backing off its maritime claims or military activities in the South China Sea. While taking a tough stance abroad might yield political dividends at home, both sides urgently need to find a way to peacefully coexist.

title: China looks to Malaysia to satisfy national durian craving as import talks accelerate
description: Talks between Chinese customs officials and Malaysian agricultural personnel on the import of fresh durians are moving forward, with some suggesting approval could come as early as 2024.
